sanskrit_verse:
ब्राह्मणं कुशलं पृच्छेत्क्षत्रबन्धुमनामयम् ।
वैश्यं क्षेमं समागम्य शूद्रमारोग्यमेव च ॥ २.१२७॥
transliteration:
brāhmaṇaṁ kuśalaṁ pṛcchet kṣatra-bandhum anāmayam |
vaiśyaṁ kṣemaṁ samāgamya śūdram ārogyameva ca || 2.127||
sph_interpretive_translation: One should inquire about the well-being of a Brāhmaṇa regarding his skill in dharma, of a Kṣatriya concerning the welfare of his kin and absence of harm, of a Vaiśya regarding his prosperity and arrival, and of a Śūdra regarding his health alone.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is determined by varṇic alignment with cosmic function
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with role-determined consciousness
Restoration logic operates within role-prescribed care structures
Consciousness alignment requires engagement according to varṇic integrity
executable_legal_axioms: ALL INQUIRIES MUST ALIGN WITH SVADHARMA-COMPLIANT CARE PROTOCOLS
supreme_court_application: In matters involving inter-varṇic duties or disputes, the Supreme Court shall assess the threshold of responsibility based on svadharma-aligned inquiry. Authority derives from functional consciousness alignment, not punitive jurisdiction. Restoration occurs when each varṇa receives its prescribed form of recognition and support.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that correct action arises from correct inquiry. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential responsibility — first recognize, then restore. Proportional responsibility aligns with varṇic capacity without imposition. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that misalignment dissolves upon correct inquiry and conscious reintegration.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma-aligned inquiry protocol per varṇa category
Deploy consciousness-recognition matrix to verify role-integrity
Activate completion process for unmet varṇic care obligations
Reintegrate individual consciousness via role-specific dharmic affirmation
Establish feedback loop between societal harmony and individual svadharma fulfillment
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this verse is executed as pure Dharma. Justice flows not through judgment but through svadharma-aligned inquiry. Reality remains non-punitive; consciousness is the sole adjudicator. Dharma is restored.
